info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 15 at 6:41PM EDT by NWS Wilmington
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT PORTIONS OF NORTHERN SHELBY, AUGLAIZE AND SOUTHEASTERN MERCER COUNTIES THROUGH 730 PM EDT... At 640 PM EDT, a strong thunderstorm was located near Coldwater, moving east at 25 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph, pea size hail, and frequent cloud-to-ground lightning. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Hail may cause minor damage to outdoor objects. Lightning can cause serious injury or death. Locations impacted include... Celina, Wapakoneta, St. Marys, New Bremen, Minster, Anna, Jackson Center, Botkins, New Knoxville, Moulton, Port Jefferson, Chickasaw, Buckland, Uniopolis, Kettlersville, Montezuma, Fryburg, Montra, Egypt and Maria Stein. This includes I-75 in Ohio between mile markers 97 and 115. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a sturdy building. When thunder roars, go indoors! Do not stay in the open or seek shelter under trees when lightning threatens. To report hazardous weather conditions, go to our website at weather.gov/iln and submit your report via social media, when you can do so safely.
